p: In the EU, current AI surveillance focuses on determining the presence of infections with subtypes H5 and H7 in different poultry species [3], [6]. To this end, sampling strategies have been set up to detect a fixed design prevalence with a certain probability (i.e., assuming minimum detectable prevalences (i.e., design prevalences) of 5% LPAI infected holdings and 30% infected animals within an infected holding). However, these methods neglect the dynamics of the infection in the population and may result in missed or delayed detection [4].
